column.description: The column to apply the count aggregate function to

arguments.description: Arguments to satisfy the column specified by 'column'

field_path.description: Path to a nested field within an object column

distinct.description: Whether or not only distinct items should be counted

column.description: The column to apply the aggregation function to

arguments.description: Arguments to satisfy the column specified by 'column'

field_path.description: Path to a nested field within an object column

filter_by.description: Does the connector support filtering based on aggregated values

group_by.description: Does the connector support aggregations over groups

count_scalar_type.description: The scalar type which should be used for the return type of count (star_count and column_count) operations.

AggregateFunctionDefinition.title: Aggregate Function Definition
AggregateFunctionDefinition.description: The definition of an aggregation function on a scalar type

result_type.description: The scalar type of the result of this function, which should have one of the type representations Int64 or Float64, depending on whether this function is defined on a scalar type with an integer or floating-point representation, respectively.
The scalar type of the result of this function, which should have the type representation Float64
The scalar or object type of the result of this function

oneOf.description: The argument is provided by reference to a variable. Only used if the 'query.variables' capability is supported.
The argument is provided as a literal value

type.description: The name of the type of this argument

oneOf.description: Check if the array contains the specified value. Only used if the 'query.nested_fields.filter_by.nested_arrays.contains' capability is supported.
Check is the array is empty. Only used if the 'query.nested_fields.filter_by.nested_arrays.is_empty' capability is supported.

Capabilities.description: Describes the features of the specification which a data connector implements.

relational_mutation.description: Does the connector support the relational mutation API? This feature is experimental and subject to breaking changes within minor versions.

relational_query.description: Does the connector support the relational query API? This feature is experimental and subject to breaking changes within minor versions.

Capabilities.title: Capabilities

query.description: Schema information relevant to query capabilities

oneOf.description: utf-8 encoded string.
signed 8bit int
signed 16bit int
signed 32bit int
signed 64bit int
unsigned 8bit int
unsigned 16bit int
unsigned 32bit int
unsigned 64bit int
32bit float
64bit float
128-bit decimal
256-bit decimal
date
time
ISO 8601 timestamp
duration
interval

arguments.description: Any arguments that this collection requires

name.description:
The name of the collection

Note: these names are abstract - there is no requirement that this name correspond to the name of an actual collection in the database.

relational_mutations.description: Information about relational mutation capabilities for this collection

type.description: The name of the collection's object type

uniqueness_constraints.description: Any uniqueness constraints enforced on this collection

ComparisonOperatorDefinition.title: Comparison Operator Definition
ComparisonOperatorDefinition.description: The definition of a comparison operator on a scalar type

argument_type.description: The type of the argument to this operator

oneOf.description: The comparison targets a column.

arguments.description: Arguments to satisfy the column specified by 'name'

field_path.description: Path to a nested field within an object column. Only non-empty if the 'query.nested_fields.filter_by' capability is supported.

oneOf.description: The comparison targets the result of aggregation. Only used if the 'query.aggregates.filter_by' capability is supported.

path.description: Non-empty collection of relationships to traverse

oneOf.description: The value to compare against should be drawn from another column

path.description: Any relationships to traverse to reach this column. Only non-empty if the 'relationships.relation_comparisons' is supported.

arguments.description: Arguments to satisfy the column specified by 'name'

field_path.description: Path to a nested field within an object column. Only non-empty if the 'query.nested_fields.filter_by' capability is supported.

scope.description: The scope in which this column exists, identified by an top-down index into the stack of scopes. The stack grows inside each `Expression::Exists`, so scope 0 (the default) refers to the current collection, and each subsequent index refers to the collection outside its predecessor's immediately enclosing `Expression::Exists` expression. Only used if the 'query.exists.named_scopes' capability is supported.

oneOf.description: A scalar value to compare against
A value to compare against that is to be drawn from the query's variables. Only used if the 'query.variables' capability is supported.

path.description: Any (object) relationships to traverse to reach this column. Only non-empty if the 'relationships' capability is supported.

arguments.description: Arguments to satisfy the column specified by 'column_name'

field_path.description: Path to a nested field within an object column

extraction.description: The name of the extraction function to apply to the selected value, if any

message.description: A human-readable summary of the error

details.description: Any additional structured information about the error

named_scopes.description: Does the connector support named scopes in column references inside EXISTS predicates

nested_scalar_collections.description: Does the connector support filtering over nested scalar arrays using existential quantification. This means the connector must support ExistsInCollection::NestedScalarCollection.

oneOf.description: The rows to evaluate the exists predicate against come from a related collection. Only used if the 'relationships' capability is supported.

field_path.description: Path to a nested field within an object column that must be navigated before the relationship is navigated. Only non-empty if the 'relationships.nested.filtering' capability is supported.

relationship.description: The name of the relationship to follow

arguments.description: Values to be provided to any collection arguments

oneOf.description: The rows to evaluate the exists predicate against come from an unrelated collection Only used if the 'query.exists.unrelated' capability is supported.

arguments.description: Values to be provided to any collection arguments

oneOf.description: The rows to evaluate the exists predicate against come from a nested array field. Only used if the 'query.exists.nested_collections' capability is supported.

field_path.description: Path to a nested collection via object columns

oneOf.description: Specifies a column that contains a nested array of scalars. The array will be brought into scope of the nested expression where each element becomes an object with one '__value' column that contains the element value. Only used if the 'query.exists.nested_scalar_collections' capability is supported.

field_path.description: Path to a nested collection via object columns

details.description: A list of human-readable key-value pairs describing a query execution plan. For example, a connector for a relational database might return the generated SQL and/or the output of the `EXPLAIN` command. An API-based connector might encode a list of statically-known API calls which would be made.

oneOf.description: A comparison against a nested array column. Only used if the 'query.nested_fields.filter_by.nested_arrays' capability is supported.

ExtractionFunctionDefinition.title: Extraction Function Definition
ExtractionFunctionDefinition.description: The definition of an aggregation function on a scalar type

result_type.description: The result type, which must be a defined scalar type in the schema response.
The result type, which must be a defined scalar type in the schema response.
The result type, which must be a defined scalar type in the schema response.
The result type, which must be a defined scalar type in the schema response.
The result type, which must be a defined scalar type in the schema response.
The result type, which must be a defined scalar type in the schema response.
The result type, which must be a defined scalar type in the schema response.
The result type, which must be a defined scalar type in the schema response.
The result type, which must be a defined scalar type in the schema response.
The result type, which must be a defined scalar type in the schema response.
The result type, which must be a defined scalar type in the schema response.
The result type, which must be a defined scalar type in the schema response.
The result type, which must be a defined scalar type in the schema response.
The scalar or object type of the result of this function

oneOf.description: A field satisfied by returning the value of a row's column.

fields.description: When the type of the column is a (possibly-nullable) array or object, the caller can request a subset of the complete column data, by specifying fields to fetch here. If omitted, the column data will be fetched in full.

oneOf.description: A field satisfied by navigating a relationship from the current row to a related collection. Only used if the 'relationships' capability is supported.

relationship.description: The name of the relationship to follow for the subquery

arguments.description: Values to be provided to any collection arguments

column_mapping.description: The columns on which you want want to define the foreign key. This is a mapping between fields on object type to columns on the foreign collection. The column on the foreign collection is specified via a field path (ie. an array of field names that descend through nested object fields). The field path must only contain a single item, meaning a column on the foreign collection's type, unless the 'relationships.nested' capability is supported, in which case multiple items can be used to denote a nested object field.

arguments.description: Any arguments that this collection requires

result_type.description: The name of the function's result type

dimensions.description: Values of dimensions which identify this group

filter.description: Does the connector support post-grouping predicates

order.description: Does the connector support post-grouping ordering

paginate.description: Does the connector support post-grouping pagination

oneOf.description: A scalar value to compare against
A value to compare against that is to be drawn from the query's variables. Only used if the 'query.variables' capability is supported.

elements.description: The elements to order by, in priority order

index.description: The index of the dimension to order by, selected from the dimensions provided in the `Grouping` request.

aggregates.description: Aggregates to compute in each group

dimensions.description: Dimensions along which to partition the data

limit.description: Optionally limit to N groups Only used if the 'query.aggregates.group_by.paginate' capability is supported.

offset.description: Optionally offset from the Nth group Only used if the 'query.aggregates.group_by.paginate' capability is supported.

order_by.description: Optionally specify how groups should be ordered Only used if the 'query.aggregates.group_by.order' capability is supported.

predicate.description: Optionally specify a predicate to apply after grouping rows. Only used if the 'query.aggregates.group_by.filter' capability is supported.

oneOf.description: Only used when the capability `relational_query.join.join_types.left` is supported.
Only used when the capability `relational_query.join.join_types.right` is supported.
Only used when the capability `relational_query.join.join_types.inner` is supported.
Only used when the capability `relational_query.join.join_types.full` is supported.
Only used when the capability `relational_query.join.join_types.left_anti` is supported.
Only used when the capability `relational_query.join.join_types.left_semi` is supported.
Only used when the capability `relational_query.join.join_types.right_anti` is supported.
Only used when the capability `relational_query.join.join_types.right_semi` is supported.

LeafCapability.description: A unit value to indicate a particular leaf capability is supported. This is an empty struct to allow for future sub-capabilities.

explain.description: Does the connector support explaining mutations

transactional.description: Does the connector support executing multiple mutations in a transaction.

arguments.description: Any named procedure arguments

fields.description: The fields to return from the result, or null to return everything

collection_relationships.description: The relationships between collections involved in the entire mutation request. Only used if the 'relationships' capability is supported.

request_arguments.description: Values to be provided to request-level arguments.

operation_results.description: The results of each mutation operation, in the same order as they were received

contains.description: Does the connector support filtering over nested arrays by checking if the array contains a value. This must be supported for all types that can be contained in an array that implement an 'eq' comparison operator.

is_empty.description: Does the connector support filtering over nested arrays by checking if the array is empty. This must be supported no matter what type is contained in the array.

oneOf.title: NestedCollection
oneOf.description: Perform a query over the nested array's rows. Only used if the 'query.nested_fields.nested_collections' capability is supported.

aggregates.description: Does the connector support aggregating values within nested fields

filter_by.description: Does the connector support filtering by values of nested fields

nested_collections.description: Does the connector support nested collection queries using `NestedField::NestedCollection`

order_by.description: Does the connector support ordering by values of nested fields

nested_arrays.description: Does the connector support filtering over nested arrays (ie. Expression::ArrayComparison)

array.description: Does the connector support navigating a relationship from inside a nested object inside a nested array

filtering.description: Does the connector support filtering over a relationship that starts from inside a nested object

ordering.description: Does the connector support ordering over a relationship that starts from inside a nested object

ObjectField.title: Object Field
ObjectField.description: The definition of an object field

arguments.description: The arguments available to the field - Matches implementation from CollectionInfo

ObjectType.title: Object Type
ObjectType.description: The definition of an object type

fields.description: Fields defined on this object type

foreign_keys.description: Any foreign keys defined for this object type's columns

elements.description: The elements to order by, in priority order

oneOf.description: The ordering is performed over a column.

path.description: Any (object) relationships to traverse to reach this column. Only non-empty if the 'relationships' capability is supported. 'PathElement.field_path' will only be non-empty if the 'relationships.nested.ordering' capability is supported.

arguments.description: Arguments to satisfy the column specified by 'name'

field_path.description: Path to a nested field within an object column. Only non-empty if the 'query.nested_fields.order_by' capability is supported.

oneOf.description: The ordering is performed over the result of an aggregation. Only used if the 'relationships.order_by_aggregate' capability is supported.

path.description: Non-empty collection of relationships to traverse. Only non-empty if the 'relationships' capability is supported. 'PathElement.field_path' will only be non-empty if the 'relationships.nested.ordering' capability is supported.

arguments.description: Values to be provided to any collection arguments

field_path.description: Path to a nested field within an object column that must be navigated before the relationship is navigated. Only non-empty if the 'relationships.nested' capability is supported (plus perhaps one of the sub-capabilities, depending on the feature using the PathElement).

predicate.description: A predicate expression to apply to the target collection

relationship.description: The name of the relationship to follow

arguments.description: Any arguments that this collection requires

result_type.description: The name of the result type

aggregates.description: Aggregate fields of the query. Only used if the 'query.aggregates' capability is supported.

groups.description: Optionally group and aggregate the selected rows. Only used if the 'query.aggregates.group_by' capability is supported.

offset.description: Optionally offset from the Nth result

order_by.description: Optionally specify how rows should be ordered

predicate.description: Optionally specify a predicate to apply to the rows

aggregates.description: Does the connector support aggregate queries

exists.description: Does the connector support EXISTS predicates

explain.description: Does the connector support explaining queries

nested_fields.description: Does the connector support nested fields

variables.description: Does the connector support queries which use variables

aggregates.description: Schema information relevant to aggregate query capabilities

QueryRequest.description: This is the request body of the query POST endpoint

arguments.description: Values to be provided to any collection arguments

collection_relationships.description: Any relationships between collections involved in the query request. Only used if the 'relationships' capability is supported.

request_arguments.description: Values to be provided to request-level arguments.

variables.description: One set of named variables for each rowset to fetch. Each variable set should be subtituted in turn, and a fresh set of rows returned. Only used if the 'query.variables' capability is supported.

QueryRequest.title: Query Request

QueryResponse.title: Query Response
QueryResponse.description: Query responses may return multiple RowSets when using queries with variables. Else, there should always be exactly one RowSet

group_by.description: Only non-empty if the 'relational_query.aggregate.group_by' capability is supported.

arguments.description: Values to be provided to any collection arguments

collection.description: The name of the collection to delete from

relation.description: The relation that identifies which rows to delete

affected_rows.description: The number of rows that were deleted

collection.description: The name of the collection to insert into

arguments.description: Values to be provided to any collection arguments

columns.description: The columns to insert values for

rows.description: The rows to insert, each row containing values for the specified columns

affected_rows.description: The number of rows that were inserted

oneOf.description: utf-8 encoded string.
signed 8bit int
signed 16bit int
signed 32bit int
signed 64bit int
unsigned 8bit int
unsigned 16bit int
unsigned 32bit int
unsigned 64bit int
32bit float
64bit float
128-bit decimal
256-bit decimal
Date stored as a signed 32bit int days since UNIX epoch 1970-01-01
Date stored as a signed 64bit int milliseconds since UNIX epoch 1970-01-01
Time stored as a signed 32bit int as seconds since midnight
Time stored as a signed 32bit int as milliseconds since midnight
Time stored as a signed 64bit int as microseconds since midnight
Time stored as a signed 64bit int as nanoseconds since midnight
Timestamp Second
Timestamp Milliseconds
Timestamp Microseconds
Timestamp Nanoseconds
Duration in seconds
Duration in milliseconds
Duration in microseconds
Duration in nanoseconds
Interval represented as months, days, and nanoseconds

RelationalMutationCapabilities.description: Describes which features of the relational mutation API are supported by the connector. This feature is experimental and subject to breaking changes within minor versions.
RelationalMutationCapabilities.title: Relational Mutation Capabilities

insertable.description: Whether inserts are supported for this collection

updatable.description: Whether updates are supported for this collection

deletable.description: Whether deletes are supported for this collection

request_arguments.description: Values to be provided to request-level arguments.

RelationalQueryCapabilities.description: Describes which features of the relational query API are supported by the connector. This feature is experimental and subject to breaking changes within minor versions.
RelationalQueryCapabilities.title: Relational Query Capabilities

from_type.description: Does the connector support `from_type` in cast?

interval.description: Does the connector support the INTERVAL scalar type? Both interval literals and casts to the INTERVAL type are implied by this capability.

arguments.description: Values to be provided to any collection arguments

collection.description: The name of the collection to update

relation.description: The relation that identifies which rows to update

affected_rows.description: The number of rows that were updated

column_mapping.description: A mapping between columns on the source row to columns on the target collection. The column on the target collection is specified via a field path (ie. an array of field names that descend through nested object fields). The field path will only contain a single item, meaning a column on the target collection's type, unless the 'relationships.nested' capability is supported, in which case multiple items denotes a nested object field.

arguments.description: Values to be provided to any collection arguments

oneOf.description: The argument is provided by reference to a variable. Only used if the 'query.variables' capability is supported.
The argument is provided as a literal value

nested.description: Does the connector support navigating a relationship from inside a nested object

order_by_aggregate.description: Does the connector support ordering by an aggregated array relationship?

relation_comparisons.description: Does the connector support comparisons that involve related collections (ie. joins)?

query_arguments.description: Any arguments that all Query requests require

mutation_arguments.description: Any arguments that all Mutation requests require

relational_query_arguments.description: Any arguments that all Relational Query requests require

aggregates.description: The results of the aggregates returned by the query

rows.description: The rows returned by the query, corresponding to the query's fields

groups.description: The results of any grouping operation

ScalarType.title: Scalar Type
ScalarType.description: The definition of a scalar type, i.e. types that can be used as the types of columns.

representation.description: A description of valid values for this scalar type.

aggregate_functions.description: A map from aggregate function names to their definitions. Result type names must be defined scalar types declared in ScalarTypesCapabilities.

comparison_operators.description: A map from comparison operator names to their definitions. Argument type names must be defined scalar types declared in ScalarTypesCapabilities.

extraction_functions.description: A map from extraction function names to their definitions.

capabilities.description: Schema data which is relevant to features enabled by capabilities

collections.description: Collections which are available for queries

functions.description: Functions (i.e. collections which return a single column and row)

object_types.description: A list of object types which can be used as the types of arguments, or return types of procedures. Names should not overlap with scalar type names.

procedures.description: Procedures which are available for execution as part of mutations

request_arguments.description: Request level arguments which are required for queries and mutations

scalar_types.description: A list of scalar types which will be used as the types of collection columns

Type.title: Type
Type.description: Types track the valid representations of values as JSON

oneOf.description: A named type

name.description: The name can refer to a scalar or object type

oneOf.description: A nullable type

underlying_type.description: The type of the non-null inhabitants of this type

oneOf.description: An array type

element_type.description: The type of the elements of the array

oneOf.description: A predicate type for a given object type
JSON booleans
Any JSON string
A 8-bit signed integer with a minimum value of -2^7 and a maximum value of 2^7 - 1
A 16-bit signed integer with a minimum value of -2^15 and a maximum value of 2^15 - 1
A 32-bit signed integer with a minimum value of -2^31 and a maximum value of 2^31 - 1
A 64-bit signed integer with a minimum value of -2^63 and a maximum value of 2^63 - 1
An IEEE-754 single-precision floating-point number
An IEEE-754 double-precision floating-point number
Arbitrary-precision integer string
Arbitrary-precision decimal string
UUID string (8-4-4-4-12)
ISO 8601 date
ISO 8601 timestamp
ISO 8601 timestamp-with-timezone
GeoJSON, per RFC 7946
GeoJSON Geometry object, per RFC 7946
Base64-encoded bytes
Arbitrary JSON
One of the specified string values

unique_columns.description: A list of columns which this constraint requires to be unique
